intro: Machaerina stradbrokensis, commonly known as the Stradbroke mace, is a unique flowering plant native to the island of Stradbroke in Queensland, Australia. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, mace-like fruit that resembles a crown. The plant typically grows in coastal heathland and is adapted to the sandy, well-drained soils of its habitat. Machaerina stradbrokensis is a rare and endangered species, with limited distribution and specific ecological requirements. Its conservation is crucial for maintaining the biodiversity of the region.
